alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 9:54PM PDT until May 22 at 9:49PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Flood Warnings continue for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Warm temperatures this weekend will melt high mountain snowpack and result in increased river flows. Minor flooding is forecast to continue for the next several days for both rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.3 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM PDT Thursday the stage was 24.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM PDT Thursday was 24.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 24.8 feet late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.8 feet on 11/10/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Cold and swift flowing rivers can be life threatening this time of year. The combination of cold water shock and fast current increases the danger of drowning in our rivers. Keep an eye on children if they are playing near rivers and put a life jacket on them. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 400 PM PDT.
